Class Patient

  • java.lang.Object
    • Patient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Patient>

    public class Patient
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Patient>
    Represents a Patient at the Emergency Room at a Hospital Each Patient has a name and initials, an arrival time, total waiting time total treatment time and has been examined by the triage team at reception who has assigned a priority (1 - 3) and a list of treatments that Patient must have (scans, examinations, operations, etc) a list of the times that the patient will spend in each treatment Methods: completedAllTreatments() -> boolean completedCurrentTreatment() -> boolean getNextTreatment() -> String (name of department for next treatment) waitForATick() advanceTreatmentByTick() incrementTreatmentNumber()

    • Constructor Summary

      Patient(int time, int triPriority)
      Construct a new Patient object parameters are the arrival time and the priority.

      void incrementTreatmentNumber()
      Advance the index to the next treatment they need Only changes the index in the Patient; Doesn't move them to the next department!! Throws an exception if the patient has no more treatments to visit

      Create a random name using the lists below

      Create a sequence of random treatments in trts and times The sequence is influenced by priority of the patient: - high priority patients are more likely to need the operating theatre first, and a more complicated treatment sequence.

    • Method Detail

      • advanceTreatmentByTick

        public void advanceTreatmentByTick()
        Reduce the remaining time of the current treatment by 1 tick. Throws an exception if the patient has already completed all treatments. or if the treatment at the head of the queue is finished (Ie, always ensure that the patient is not yet completed before calling)

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Patient other)
        (COMPLETION) Compare this Patient with another Patient to determine who should be treated first. A patient should be earlier in the ordering if they should be treated first. The ordering depends on the triage priority and the arrival time.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Patient>

      • completedAllTreatments

        public boolean completedAllTreatments()
        Return true if the patient has completed all their treatments.

      • completedCurrentTreatment

        public boolean completedCurrentTreatment()
        Return true if patient has completed their current treatment

      • getNextTreatment

        public java.lang.String getNextTreatment()
        Return the next treatment the patient needs Throws an exception if the patient has no more treatments to visit

      • incrementTreatmentNumber

        public void incrementTreatmentNumber()
        Advance the index to the next treatment they need Only changes the index in the Patient; Doesn't move them to the next department!! Throws an exception if the patient has no more treatments to visit

      • makeRandomName

        public void makeRandomName()
        Create a random name using the lists below

      • makeRandomTreatments

        public void makeRandomTreatments()
        Create a sequence of random treatments in trts and times The sequence is influenced by priority of the patient: - high priority patients are more likely to need the operating theatre first, and a more complicated treatment sequence. low priority patients are more likely to just need an ERbed treatment.

      • randomTreatmentTime

        public int randomTreatmentTime(int median)
        Returns a random treatment time with the given median (half the treatment times will be below the median; half above). Always at least 1 tick; but some take a long time. (Based on a log-normal distribution, mu=0, sigma=0.6. increase sigma to spread it out more)

      • redraw

        public void redraw(double x,
                   double y)
        Draw the patient: 6 units wide, 28 units high x,y specifies center of the base

        public void waitForATick()
        Make Patient wait for one tick. Recorded on totalWaitTime
